thread.title: NASCAR driver Austin Theriault airlifted to hospital after head-on hit at Las Vegas
thread.title_full: NASCAR driver Austin Theriault airlifted to hospital after head-on hit at Las Vegas

author: customerservice@sportingnews.com (Joe Rodgers)
title: NASCAR driver Austin Theriault airlifted to hospital after head-on hit at Las Vegas
text:
NASCAR driver Austin Theriault airlifted to hospital after head-on hit at Las Vegas Sporting News 21 hrs ago customerservice@sportingnews.com (Joe Rodgers) NASCAR Camping World Truck Series driver Austin Theriault was airlifted to a local hospital Saturday night after a high-speed, head-on wreck into an unprotected concrete wall at Las Vegas Motor Speedway.
AdChoices Just 14 laps into the Rhino Linings 350, Tyler Reddick got loose in Turn 4 and was unable to correct his truck, catching the rear of Theriault and sending him into an area of the wall not protected by SAFER barrier.
MORE: NASCAR's toughest drivers
After the wreck, Theriault was able to climb out under is own power, but was placed on a backboard before being loaded into an ambulance. He will undergo further treatment at the hospital.
When Theriault climbed out it looked like they were holding his leg, and he then appeared to point at it when medical showed up #NASCAR
â€” Kelly Crandall (@KellyCrandall) October 4, 2015
